channel.title: Portals and other objects teleport selectoption

item.title: Portals and other objects teleport selectoption
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

I have a clue as of what I’m doing. You need a line number after each, so you’re not having
selectoption2(“Where would you like to go?”, “Agility course”, “Runecrafting area”, “Runecrafting area 2”, “”);
On one freaking line.

Read full topic
item.source: Portals and other objects teleport selectoption

item.title: Portals and other objects teleport selectoption
item.dc:creator: @cwg452003 cwg452003
item.description:
@cwg452003 wrote:

omg selectoption2 is exactly what u said, i just declared a void so i could keep using it, and the question i’m asking is the make them clickable. Selectoption2 is this…

public void selectoption2(String question, String s1, String s2, String s3, String s4) { sendFrame171(1, 2475); sendFrame171(0, 2478); sendFrame126(question, 2470); sendFrame126(s1, 2471); sendFrame126(s2, 2472); sendFrame126(s3, 2473); sendFrame126(s4, 2474); sendFrame164(2469); }

Read full topic
item.source: Portals and other objects teleport selectoption

item.title: Portals and other objects teleport selectoption
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

case 8987: if(actionTimer == 0) { selectoption2("Where would you like to go?", "Agility course", "Runecrafting area", "Runecrafting area 2", ""); OptionObject = objectID; } break;

No offence, but that’s poorly done.

Did you add methods and ints for OptionObject or something?

It’s something like this:

8987://Action timer unneeded { sendFrame171(1, 2475); sendFrame171(0, 2478); sendFrame126(question, 2470); sendFrame126(s1, 2471); sendFrame126(s2, 2472); sendFrame126(s3, 2473); sendFrame126(s4, 2474); sendFrame164(2469); }

That should work. But clicking them will do nothing.

Read full topic
item.source: Portals and other objects teleport selectoption

item.title: Portals and other objects teleport selectoption
item.dc:creator: @pies pies
item.description:
@pies wrote:

Code: else if(OptionObject == 7352 && playerRights >= 1) { //option one sendMessage ("Welcome to the Modzone!"); //option one teleport message teleportToX = 2837; teleportToY = 10209; <---<=0) { sendMessage ("You must be a mod to go to the modzone."); }

teleportToX = 2837;
teleportToY = 10209;

Takes you to a blank area.

Read full topic
item.source: Portals and other objects teleport selectoption

item.title: Portals and other objects teleport selectoption
item.dc:creator: @cwg452003 cwg452003
item.description:
@cwg452003 wrote:

so here is the example of what i’m saying.

case 7352: if(actionTimer == 0) { selectoption("Where would you like to go?", "Modzone", "Adminzone", ""); OptionObject = objectID; } break;
so when u click the portal it shows up with that. and when you click them this is the code that makes them tele u.

else if(OptionObject == 7352 && playerRights >= 1) { //option one sendMessage ("Welcome to the Modzone!"); //option one teleport message teleportToX = 2837; teleportToY = 10209; OptionObject = -1; RemoveAllWindows(); } else if(playerRights >=0) { sendMessage ("You must be a mod to go to the modzone."); }

else if(OptionObject == 7352 && playerRights >= 2) { //teleport place 2 sendMessage ("Welcome to the Adminzone!"); teleportToX = 2717; teleportToY = 9816; OptionObject = -1; RemoveAllWindows(); } else if(playerRights >=1) { sendMessage ("You must be an admin to go to the adminzone."); }
So i tried adding a portal with 3 options instead of just 2, so i made a selectoption2…

public void selectoption2(String question, String s1, String s2, String s3, String s4) { sendFrame171(1, 2475); sendFrame171(0, 2478); sendFrame126(question, 2470); sendFrame126(s1, 2471); sendFrame126(s2, 2472); sendFrame126(s3, 2473); sendFrame126(s4, 2474); sendFrame164(2469); }
so then i tried to make a new portal give options…

case 8987: if(actionTimer == 0) { selectoption2("Where would you like to go?", "Agility course", "Runecrafting area", "Runecrafting area 2", ""); OptionObject = objectID; } break;
So now when i click that portal it comes out with those. When i tried to code them to make them clickable it just wouldn’t work. So now i am asking u guys for your help to tell me how to make them clickable and bring u places.

Read full topic
item.source: Portals and other objects teleport selectoption
